lines.text: Oh boy. I wasn't expecting to attack this turn. I'll do the lightning again because it seemed to have some damage. No, you know what? We've got to block his sword, right? Shit. I will Bigby's Hand and try to grapple his sword.

lines.text: I will sing, (singing) I'm freaked out by the shape of me! I'm burned up and nobody can see. So you know what I'll do to thee? Give some health to my body. (vocalizing) (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Holy shit!

lines.name: MARISHA

lines.text: Certainly. Which direction?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, a little bit closer. Yeah.

lines.text: You fly over. As you swing, it glances in your direction and with a reaction, gets an attack of opportunity on you with disadvantage. That's 20. What's your armor class in the planetar form?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 19, so it hits me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hashtag blessed, though!

lines.text: I am blessed!

lines.text: Doesn't add to your armor class. It's attacks and saving throws. It's a level one spell, guys. It hits you. You take... 42 points of slashing damage, and I need you to make a constitution saving throw.

lines.text: You are not immune to blindness as a planetar.

lines.name: TALIESIN

lines.name: MARISHA

lines.text: Yes. That's plus seven.

lines.text: That's cool, but then I still have my war caster ability, too, right? I have advantage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, that's against concentration, so you will have to do that in a second, but first, this is to see if you go blind or not. This is a curse effect.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Don't they have truesight and stuff?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I do have truesight as a planetar. It is pretty good, so that's 27.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 27? Okay. You resist the blindness. However, now half that damage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You said 42?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So half of that is 21, so DC 21. Make a constitution saving throw with advantage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: With a d4.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm good. 17 plus my constitution?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you're fine. So you maintain concentration on your form. Perfect. That finishes Keyleth's turn. Grog, what are you doing?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. It's hammer time. I'm going to run down here-- five, ten, 15-- right there, to this side.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The elemental gets one swing at you as you go out of its range. That is a three plus seven. Ten. It hits your back and it's like, ooh. It's kind of cool.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And I'll take both of my attacks at the giant death-bringer. Just reckless, not great weapon master. Hoping for a crit, which was not it. 31.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Great. That's better. 32.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hits. These are both with the minus five?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, not great weapon master. Just reckless. Six, 22 for the first one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And I can't disarm him; he's a giant. And 20 for the second one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: His weapon is grappled right now, so I don't know if you'd have advantage on trying to disarm him.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He's gargantuan, though.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's already at a negative because of Bigby.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And that is it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is it? All right. So that ends your turn. At the end of your turn, Grog, it's going to go ahead and use its legendary action to swing back at you as you're hitting it. So you slam it in the back with the axe, as it angrily swings a wide strike towards its back, hoping to catch the side of your chest, with disadvantage, that is an eight plus 14. 22.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits. Okay. You take 27 points of slashing damage, reduced to be 13.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I use my stone's endurance to reduce that further?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you want to, or you can take a retaliation shot. Up to you. Don't forget your retaliation.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I was going to do it afterwards. I thought he did two hits backwards?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, stone's endurance is a reaction. You get one reaction, so it's one or the other. I'm pretty sure it is. I'll double check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I feel like we're missing at something really hard.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Essentially.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like he's invulnerable.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you can use your reactions. It's one or the other.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay, yeah. I'll do the retaliation.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Constitution saving throw, please.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You have inspiration.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank you. Going to need it. 20. I'm going to use my inspiration. 28.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 28. You resist it. No issue. So now you can take your retaliation shot.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay! Reckless, great weapon master. Why not? That's 31 minus five, that's 26?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits. Roll damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nice. Fuck. 27.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 27 points of damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That was a shit roll. I rolled a one. Oh! I reroll ones! Sorry. Reroll ones. Thanks. 12! That's way better! (cheering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's an extra 11 damage on it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 38 damage. There you go. So as you resist the effect, you come back with a third strike, slamming it into the back, and you can watch some of the armor in the back cracks. You can see bits of glowing orange in places. It's still looking fine, but it's taking hits. It isn't impervious.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This is why I wanted a stupid water elemental.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's on death's door, guys. We got him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That brings us to Percival's turn.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to run all the way back to the back of the room, I'm going to put as much distance-- well, actually I'll take my shots first. I've got Animus up, so I'm going to spend a point on it. I'm running out of grit. And I'm going to try and take a shot on this guy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm just above you telling you how hot you look as you're doing it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Physically, you're really sweaty right now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Your hair is so white. You're like Steve Martin without the ukulele. I'm just so turned on by you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 36. That hits, I assume, so that's 1d10 plus 1d6, and then I'm also going to blow the last of my lightning into that, as well. That's 18 points of standard damage, two points of psychic damage, and 15 points of lightning damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nice. 35 total on that shot.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's one shot. This is my last advantage shot. I'm going to take another advantage shot on him. Here we go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come on, dude.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's 24 on the advantage shot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's what it is. 24.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Here we go. 15 points of damage plus three points of psychic damage. I should start taking track of this. Shooting again, no advantage. 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20 does not hit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Actually, hold on. No, it wouldn't matter. 22, yeah it doesn't actually hit. So here we go. Taking three shots. Oh my god! So this is great. I take three more shots. First one is 29, so that hits.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If any of those miss, you're blessed.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's 12 points of damage and one point of psychic damage. And then let me get an extra d10 and an extra d6. This is weird. New critical. New type of critical.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What was the total on that last one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So critical damage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Critical damage. That's 11 points of psychic damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The psychic damage is doubled, too, by the way.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah! And 20 points of normal damage. 20 normal and 11 points of psychic.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so 31.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And now the next critical hit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (whispering) Yes. Yes, Percival.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come on, you sweet chinchilla.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's okay. 12 points of normal damage and six points of psychic damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So 18.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And so the two of those combined, cut in half, is what he takes next round's bleed damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Which is 49, so he'll be taking 24 points of bleed damage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm running in the opposite direction!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You broken bastard.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you run around this way.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, and that's two crits, which means I get two grits back. I'm like (grunts) that way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is as far as you can get. If you want to go that way, you'll have to go around in lava, so you have to go around. That's as far as you can get there. That ends your turn, Percival. All right, at the end of your turn it's going to use its third and final legendary action to hack down at you because you're up next.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Bring it. I have no fear.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so that is a 25.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That was with disadvantage?

lines.name: MATT, TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM

lines.text: All right, so that ends Vex's turn. Top of the round, Scanlan, you immediately take fire damage because you're still on fire, so you immediately fail a death saving throw.

lines.text: You do have Death Ward on you! So as you go and reach and grab him and pull him up, the Death Ward flickers on and he comes back to one hit point. You pull him off to the side. As soon as his turn comes up, he takes seven points of fire damage and

lines.name: LIAM

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, you're all good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty, so that brings us from Scanlan's turn to the elemental's turn. The elemental is going to go ahead and (whoosh).

lines.text: This overlay thing's pretty cool.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, right? It makes remote play not quite as removed.

lines.name: SAM

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, right here.

lines.name: MARISHA

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That we can see, I mean.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is 13 against your armor class. Does not hit. And 14 does not hit. It has the blindness on the elemental, still.

lines.name: TRAVIS

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ending that elemental's turn. It is now Grog and Keyleth's turn.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll go. Turn straight at him, reckless, great weapon master.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No. Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Technically, sorry, before we get to that, at the end of its turn, at the end of the elemental's turn, it's going to go ahead and strike you with its blade.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay. I'm going to keep that roll just in case something happens.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No worries. That's a 27 to hit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Which it does.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 36 points of slashing damage, reduced to half, so that's 18. And make a constitution saving throw, please.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have four as my planetar, so I've got two more of those that I just did, in terms of myself. I'm trying to keep tabs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 24? Yeah, you resist the blindness. So your turn, unabated as you were before.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right. Minus five, is 31 to hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, that hits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It was a great roll. And the second one is pretty big. 34 minus five is 29.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits, yeah. Both do damage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let me do a little roleplay here. Oh, baby!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 17 plus ten is 27 for the first one. Oh, nope. I'm sorry! That was a one, so I'm going to re-roll it. Five, 21, 31 for the first one. Second one. Three, 29, and my fucking necrotic dice. Two, four more.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, that ends your turn, Grog?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That does. Actually, can I move? I'm going to stay in melee, but I want to come over here in case he decides to golf-swing me into the fucking lava river.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (screaming)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Knock it off!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That reckless attack, man. He gets advantage on all his attacks against him.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's the reason I roll so high most of the time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, you kill them before they can retaliate.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 73 points of slashing damage. On 3d12, it was a ten, eight, and a 12.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What was it, 76?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So that's 37?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So half of that would be 36, we'll say. 36 points of slashing damage, and make a constitution saving throw.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: God fucking damn it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, 24.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 24, okay. Resisting it still.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I can still see?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you can still see. All right, Keyleth.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. You can still see? Everyone's good? You're up? Everyone's up?

lines.name: LAURA

lines.text: You're with him. He's fine. I'm going to fly over. 120 feet. I've got a five-foot reach range. I'm going to do my multiattack as my planetar. So two hits, with plus two. I'm going to do Gil.

lines.text: Come on, Captain Planet!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We just had three fights in the same day.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Goddamn. That's a natural 19 on one, and a natural 16 on the other! Plus 12 for both of those.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, those both hit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, and then for both of those, 4d6 plus seven, and an additional 5d8 radiant damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Kiki, it's yours.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Kill it!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, for the d6s alone. Okay, that's six plus four, that's ten plus another five, 15, plus three is 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18 plus seven. 25?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm just doing the d6s. 25, and then, not as great the second time.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you re-roll those?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, not for this. Only elemental damage. So five, six, seven, plus another seven, so 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14, okay, and then now 10d8 radiant damage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Now 10d8 radiant damage. I may just roll these twice, okay, so the first one. Okay, ten plus seven, so 17, plus another seven is 24 radiant, and then (counting) 19 damage. Radiant damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you rush across the room, rushing towards it, and strike out towards it, what do you want to do?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. (grunts) As I look around, see all my friends, blind and running around insane, I'm going to go (yells) and fly across the field, and come down with a big radiant strike, and try and invoke in the back of my head, (singing) Hallelujah! And (grunts).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see this core in the center that previously has been guarded by its stone form, and there on the inside you see this beating red gem that (power-down sound) goes cold. As it does, the guardian drops the blade (footsteps) and walks to the other side of the chamber, pieces of its armor falling off to the ground. You see cracked parts of its outer form breaking off in small chunks of shale, and it makes its way to the opposite side, walking around, carefully, each of you. It takes and places its blade (crashing) up on this stand on the wall, turns around, and goes completely inert.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Whoa. It was a trial. You had to be able to beat him in order to forge here. I'm putting Scanlan out! Because he's still on fire.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Scanlan is still on fire.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Scanlan is not on fire anymore.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is he unconscious still?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's still unconscious, so I'm going to cast Cure Wounds at level one, because that's what I can do, so I'm going to cast Cure Wounds on him to bring him back to life.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, and then I fly over, (whoosh), and do my other healing touch on Vax.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How many healing touches does he have?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Four.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait. I don't need it. Wait.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So six points, Scanlan, that's what you've got.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The massive gash across my entire body, as you stand there for 30 seconds, starts to close.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Cool. (whoosh) I go over to Scanlan and do a healing touch. 6d8. (counting) Can you give me one more d8? Okay. Scanlan, you have 14, 15, 26. You heal 26 plus three, so 29 hit points.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And you're cured from any diseases. Is anyone else blind or rough?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's gone as soon as he's done fighting.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, the blindness has faded.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have one more of these if anyone else needs healing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm in double digits, which is uncomfortable for me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, you're low double digits, too!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're low double digits? (whoosh)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Where are you at?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I drop same thing into Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I got my ass handed to me. Two crits by that giant bastard.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That reckless, man. That's the downside.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I know. I'll take, though. It's worth the gamble.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (counting) You get 37 hit points.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The first part of this fight, he was sucking. It was like, two, three, three, two, and then he picked up. All righty. So in the silence, as you guys take a moment to breathe and recover, the uncomfortable heat in here is sweltering. The guardian is motionless across the forge. The blade is set up against the wall, now obscured by the smoke that's still billowing up across the back wall. Getting a better glance around, you can see a lot of the soot and black that has gathered in the upper areas of the ceiling, which is about 50 feet high. There you see, faintly glowing and obscuring the air above it, the Core Anvil, the chains still held taut as the various blacksmithing implements hang dangling off the sides of the central platform.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, that was a bitch. What do you say we cut to the chase and hammer this shit out?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I hope he won't come back to life as soon as we start.

lines.name: MARISHA

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's fine. No longer blind, but still. (splat) It's gone.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Keyleth goes Mickey in Fantasia for a second, and she's the axe to the brooms, killing my creation.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's a big splash up against the wall, but it's just water.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Short rest.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh! If we take a short rest, he can inspire us when we do this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, we should probably, if we can, take a short rest.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a half hour? Yeah, that was hard.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I want to sit down.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just so you guys can think about your process, know exactly what you're doing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We do need to discuss this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: While you guys are taking a short rest, you can heal up with your hit dice. I also need everyone to make a constitution saving throw, please, because it's so hot in here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do I, with the fire on the Deathwalker's Ward?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. And me with the mantle?

lines.text: I'll say you have to make it, as well, Vax, just make it with advantage.

lines.text: Scanlan?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I rolled that poop thing again.

lines.text: You got a lot of hit dice that you can roll.

lines.text: I do, but still. Four.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your constitution modifier is?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Five.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And now I'm up to top again, and it only took two hit dice. And then I get my heal back. I get my action surges back. Grit comes back on a short rest.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm back to 144.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Back at the temporary 137, due to the feast.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to really quickly fix Bad News. All right, I fixed Bad News.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wow. And so many things don't work anymore. Okay. Yeah.

lines.text: Oh, my Hex is burned, my Spider Climb's burned, Diplomacy is a long rest before that goes again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You find numerous sets of tongs. You find twisting tools. You find metal punches. You find chisels of all sizes. You see a form of leg vise that's laying at the side of the anvil which you know immediately, weirdly for you, a leg vise is a small device that you use to clamp metal onto the anvil to work on it. You use your foot to hold down with pressure. You also see the hammer that was chained to it, as well, which is very well made. The dark black hammer metal look with gold inlay. It looks like scrolling all across it in places. All these different tools are all chained to the actual sides of the anvil.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I tell what material the black part of the hammer is made out of? If it's rock, metal, some sort of volcanic glass?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It appears to be metal.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So these trammels need to be made out of platinum. You know how to do it, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, I know how to do it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. So what do we do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have the chunks of platinum. I hand the chunks of platinum over to Percy to put the-- I guess they don't have to be in--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to have to smelt them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're going to be melted.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So we should do that, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to have to start with smelting them. Well, I don't know. You know the process, I don't. Why am I in character talking to the dungeon master? What's happening? Ah, the meta.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is the forging chamber. The other doors are still closed. Once they're made into bars, and this is from the design that you recall Ioun gave you, the beads of divinity that you've been given, you have to actually shatter across the anvil and then fold the pieces into the metal.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Cool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Once that's done then you actually have a solid blank of platinum inlaid with the fragments of divinity. You then have to draw out the trammel tips, which makes them into a fine point like a long javelin-like rod. Then you have to use the vise, after heating the metal, to twist the trammels. The actual design has them twisted because it helps conduct the divine energy to the point. And then using the chiseling tools, you have to work in the runes that match and channel the incantation that Scanlan's book has. It's a multi-process step that's going to require both of you to work together on this, since some elements of it are blacksmithing elements, some of it are tinkering.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So we have to get into the other room first before we do any of that. Can I fly over and see if I can find any kind of apparatus that would--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Investigation?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So 30. You glance up and you see it looks there like there were two chains that were originally down held on a crank device. However, the chain has been cut and the other half of it is about 20 feet up in the air.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to try.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Why don't you and I try?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, but you can't fly anymore.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can, though. I still have wings.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You fly on one and I'll try to get the other one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So planetar form. Go ahead and make a strength check, please.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I am looking right now. My strength is 24, so plus seven. (scoffs) Again. Why again with the threes?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Put that one away.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I rolled a 13.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You two tug on those chains, and they are not moving.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can the guardian do it? Hey, you that was attacking us. Can you get those chains?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughs) Really? Yeah, it wasn't a very persuasive thing to say. 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14? It makes no motion, change, nothing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Shorthalt, you got any Bigby's left in you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I could do one if we really need it. What's wrong with Grog? He can't do it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's too high.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He could do one. We could get him up there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is the end of the chain able to where I can pull to at least make it reach Grog or no?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you don't have the strength to pull it down, not with that strength check, unfortunately.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can you Bigby one and maybe Vex can slowly pull Grog up to that thing on your broom?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Or she could probably lift Grog up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I fly Grog up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (grunts)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Kicking my feet, which doesn't make it any easier.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Dog-paddling.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But you do get up, Grog, and you grab the chain. Make a strength check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm not still raging, unfortunately.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can still be raging if you want to.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're very angry about it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you lift him up, you grab the chain and rappelling down, you begin to find places in the stonework and metal on the side and hold on with your other hand, pull. As you do, you watch the wall on the opposite side (scraping) move up on one side a little bit and get stuck.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should I Bigby the other?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. I'll have to do it at level seven.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh shit. We're so tapped out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So Bigby's Hand appears, (whoosh) rushes up to the other chain. Go ahead and make a d20 roll and add an eight to it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As Bigby pulls the other side, the wall on the opposite side adjusts and both chains now, Grog and Bigby's Hand together, pull and pull and pull and slowly, as you're both pulling across the metal and dragging it downward, the opposite wall (scraping). Opens up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh wait. Is this an ability check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm exhausted.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Bigby isn't, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Bigby isn't. It's a check for the spell, not for you. So together you both eventually bring the chains to the bottom and you find one of the number of hooks on the floor area where you can wrap it around to hold it in place. It's tenuous but it's holding. And so the large metal door on the opposite side is currently now held up about 13 feet up. It's only partway up right now but that's all you need at the moment.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can Grog and them let go? Is it going to slam shut?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They found large rings and hooks to hook them onto.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We hurry to the other room.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We hurry to the other room. If we can get any inspiration, too, before we start this process.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Short rest, so he has his inspiration back.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's just smelt for now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That fell to the wayside before.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have advantage on dexterity-based ability checks.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh that's right, that's the one. Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take in pieces of platinum equal to the amounts you guys had pulled up before. How much was it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 300 platinum each.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That was for the face. For the trammels.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. Would those little pyramids work to make the trammels? Or it needs more?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, no. There's other molds there with the smelting device.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I got 4,920 platinum.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If I recall, it was 1,500 platinum per piece, I believe.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So 4,500. So enough for three trammels.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you guys made the platinum transition when you were in Vasselheim. And the reason it takes so much is because even the natural platinum that's out there has some impurities in the process of the creating so you guys have to repeatedly go through and burn and pull out impure segments of the metals that come to the top.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Make sure you use some of those pyramids we made, though.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, so we don't waste that platinum that we melted into triangles.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So Grog, I need you to go ahead and make a blacksmithing tool check. This is with proficiency bonus. It should be dexterity for this.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: At which you have advantage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Which I have advantage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. So you'd roll twice.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 1,500 per trammel? Of platinum. Okay. We're fine. Yeah. Can you get your calculator out? Never mind. I can do this it myself.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, figure out what dex plus proficiency. Whatever your dex plus prof is.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, advantage. Right. I got it. 19.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, do you want me to inspire you or anything? Do you all need anything?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How long does inspiration last for?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Up to ten minutes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's wait until the final--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So. It takes you a good 20 minutes or so, 30 minutes or so per ingot to get all the impurities out, to heat it and to scoop it out. Eventually gets so you can form three bars of pure platinum to the level that you know the requirements of the trammel are. You look around. You don't see any areas here to cool the metal. You didn't get a good look at the other chamber necessarily to see if there was something for it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I still have the Alchemy Jug with the water in it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You might shatter that jug.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's probably everything we need in here if we take a look around.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you need water?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to need water.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I fly around and see what we can see?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Behind and in the center of the two machines you do see a trough about eight feet on one side and three feet the width of it. It is empty, however.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I go over and cast Create Water.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You manage to fill the trough, brimming with cool, instantly created water.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We've got a trough!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Back and forth, you guys take the molds with tongs and (sizzling) quench the metal and pull out the three heavy platinum ingots, ready for use on the actual anvil.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This just turned into an Aerosmith video.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter) So. Now that you're working on the forge, you have your Gauntlets on. The two of you walk up and you have all these tools around you. To fold the metal, you're going to need the hammer. So you grab the hammer and the hammer's pretty big. It's like a maul. It's a two-handed hammer.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I love this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You need the beads of divinity for this next stage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Who's got the beads?

lines.name: LAURA, SAM
lines.text: I've got a bead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you take the Ioun one, which has a faint whitish-gray glow, and place it in the center of the anvil. Go ahead and make a strength check, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I go into a rage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You may.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (heavy breathing) That's even better. 25.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25. With a giant echoing yell, (grunts) you bring the hammer down and you watch a flash of bright, vibrant white, faintly blue light flicker and beam across the room. All of you for a second have to hold your eyes and look away and as you come back, the hammer is on top of the anvil. As you pull it back, you see, where the bead was, there is now a crushed dust of the same color, roughly about the size of a plate. None of it's scattered away from the anvil, it is a crystalline diamond-like powder that remains.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do we fold this into one of the ingots? One at a time?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: One at a time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So with you holding the tongs and helping him, you take the hammer. I need you to make a blacksmithing tool check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: With advantage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is with strength, on this one. This is hammering the metal and folding it into the metal.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That is a 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19's fine. The hammering isn't too hard. The different things have different difficulties, and so the folding isn't too bad. So with that, you guys take the dust and you scatter it across the metal and then hammer and fold, hammer and fold and take more and scatter it across the metal as it's still heated. Hammer and fold, then go and take it off to the side to two of the coal areas, and you watch as the furnaces burn and heat the metal up again. You bring it back up to the steps and hammer and fold, hammer and fold with more of it until eventually, you've managed to hammer in over the next 20 or so minutes, both of you sweating, feeling a little bit of stiffness and soreness in your arms from this process, but you've been far worse.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're cheering them on the side. Good forging! Fold that metal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You eventually build a rod blank for your first trammel using the bead of divinity from Ioun. That is complete. So who's next?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Whose bead is up next?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh god. All right, here we go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So you take the faintly yellowish-glowing bead of divinity from the Dawnfather, place it onto the anvil. Make another strength check, please.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does he need inspiration?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Persistent rage. I'm raging balls this whole time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you still have an inspiration on you right now?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I do not.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Scanlan?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you want me to inspire you?

lines.name: TRAVIS, LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, I will-- I go up to Grog and I tell him: Grog, I'm going to tell you some words of wisdom that I learned from a book once. A wise man said, "The man who hast smelted verily didst also "dealt it."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wisdom. Unparalleled wisdom!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So with advantage, and you're still raging on this.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, that's amazing. Yeah. 25.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25 again.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 17 plus eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Repeating the process until you get all through it. I need you to go ahead and make another blacksmithing tool check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Advantage because of the Cat's Grace. It's a 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is strength, still.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, it is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. I'll tell you if it's dex or strength because you're hammering the metal. He's turning it over.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 27. Yeah. Without an issue, you guys manage to fold in your second trammel blank without worry. Bringing you to the third one, the third and final.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Bead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Producing and placing onto the anvil, Vax, you leave behind there the small jet black smooth oval bead.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I reach into my pouch and I take out one of my peas that I got, and I put it on the anvil.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't do it. Get it off of there, Grog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Strength check, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Raging strength check. Okay. It's inspiration time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Inspiration time?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm going to use the dice.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Because you didn't use it before?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, he hasn't used it. (gasps)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's a 24.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 24. (clang) You slam down. And you pull back the hammer, and there it remains. Unshattered.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Try it again.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But my arms are really sore. I need a massage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to over and rub his muscles.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Grog, if you do this I will give you something really cool. Really cool.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: By whose standards, yours or mine?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yours.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you want to inspire him again, Scanlan?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, I do. I will sing to him. (singing) Pour some platinum on thee and get it on an anvil. Pour some platinum on thee when you need a trammel!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Take your d12. All right, Grog, as you try again, pulling the large maul hammer up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No. Come on, Gil. That's dog shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm not even going to use the inspiration because it won't get us there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Try one more time. Can he try again?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, now hold on. I would have to roll a 12. Of a d12.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You'd have to roll a 12?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Try it, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's up to you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, motherfuck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (impact) You slam down with a second hit. As it hits, the reverberation of the impact fills the room. You pull the hammer back and there it remains, but you do see a mild crack through its form.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (panting) I'll try one more time. One more. No inspiration.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I do anything to help him?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No. Let's just do it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I give him Guidance?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you get any more inspiration, Scanlan?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure. Yeah, I can inspire one more time.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hold on. Let me try it without the inspiration. Let me try.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you give him Guidance, it will give him an additional d4 he gets to add.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But it would get rid of his Cat's Grace, but you're not using it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh yeah, because it's concentration.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let me do it straight up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a cantrip. I'm going to give you Guidance! I'm doing it! Guidance!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as you're doing this, Keyleth comes up behind and then touches you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Come on, Grog! Come on! That's my Guidance.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I didn't need it. 25 on the dot.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What could have been only two trammels, you barely manage to succeed in properly shattering and not ruining the third bead. (impact) As you slam, all of you for a second see nothing but darkness. All the light, all the flame, even the heat of the room goes jet cold for an instant. And all of a sudden, the light of the furnaces flicker back on, the machine once more (crushing). The engine slams and light filters back. You pull the hammer back. You see a scattering of darkened coal, obsidian dust remaining behind.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I've never been so happy to see a 17 before. Oh my god.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Work that Play-Doh. Come on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With that, you two holding the tongs, you take and fold the metal, hammer it, fold the metal, hammer it. Make another blacksmithing check. Go ahead and make your final blank.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, but now you can add things.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I've got advantage. Is it strength or dex?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is strength still, this one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You still have Guidance.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But I get a d4 on top of it? Oh, that's great. 26 without the other stuff.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Without an issue. So with that, you fold and you have your three finished trammel blanks, each one infused with the bead of divinity. Now you need to draw them out. And you can do these as one check for the three of them. So you go in and you take these blanks, these long rods, and you heat up the tip and bring it back, you holding with the tongs. You begin to, at an angle, hammering it against the top of the anvil, to eventually bring it to a gradual point. I need you to go ahead and make a blacksmithing check. This will be dexterity because this is less of just hammering, this is a little more careful manipulation of the metal. Did you cast Cat's Grace on him again? Because if you don't, it's not advantage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Cat's Grace.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Then I'll keep that. And then what was the Guidance? Do I have Guidance any more?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you can't have both.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you want advantage or do you want that extra d4?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Advantage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So he can still add one d4 on this?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pick one.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's a 15 with advantage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a 15?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Shall I inspire him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, you have to inspire him before he makes the check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Because it's my dexterity modifier plus my proficiency bonus, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can I help with this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are helping with this.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh god. Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) We'll get to you shortly. So as you begin to hammer it out, it's getting a little fragile at some points. I'll let you make one more check so you don't ruin one of the trammels.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Advantage, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Advantage and inspiration.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure. Yeah, I'll inspire him again.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He needs as much as you can give him, Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will give him every inch of myself.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So one? (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: One by one by one, yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Should I use the inspiration?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, you should.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 29. So this time, seeing where the imperfections were in the hammering you initially did and curving and bringing fragility to one of the trammels, you double back, heat up, and correct the mistake. Over the next ten minutes or so, you both carefully work to bring each to a razor point at the end of these large platinum javelins now. They're thicker on one side and come to an impossible point at the other. You have three of these base trammels now complete.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Now we got to twist them?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, we got to put the runes in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So now you have to twist them. This is where you bring up the leg vice. So you go ahead and you clamp it in there. This is without your help. This is now you taking and heating the metal and twisting it as you go, so make another blacksmithing check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can guide you. I can do nothing else.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is a dexterity-based.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, it's dexterity still? Then keep the advantage. You have advantage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (sobbing) I'm tired of this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does he have any more inspiration?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure. I can inspire him.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, keep inspiring.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He already rolled.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But he hasn't announced it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He already rolled.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's a 26. It's okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And as you pull up, you can see as the steam rises, the three twisted javelins of pure platinum ready for the final scrolling.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (panting) Okay. Okay, give me the cool thing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm not lying to you. It's really cool.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm too tired to be upset about it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Later. I promise.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What do you--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, let's see. What do I have to do?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The only hammer here is that maul, but all the chiseling and tinkering work takes a much smaller, more delicate hammer.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I do have the Dwarven Thrower.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's going to have to be a smaller edge than that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like what? Whisper?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Edge? Yeah?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It has to be a hammer.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Like a rock hammer.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we look around for a little teeny hammer?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Teeny hammer?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 12 for me, so probably not so much.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Make an investigation check?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Me too.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 18 for me.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Glad I got that roll out of the way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's the one singular giant hammer on the chain.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Have you picked it up? Maybe it changes shape.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to try picking the hammer up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You pick up the hammer.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to try and attune to it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you take a bit of time to attune with it, if you feel that's something you could try.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to examine it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Make an arcana check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Make another arcana check. Let's see what happens. Oh, that's better. 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take time with it and focus, and once you feel the essence of attunement begin to drift into this hammer, you unattune from one of your other items and you will it. The hammer actually (shrinking) shrinks down into a small, light hammer. Ball-peen hammer.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Smart move.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll drop Animus for now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Your coffee-stained artifacts.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I dropped my travel mug.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you do, you watch as this intricate scrolling begins to appear and dig itself into the side of each trammel. He rotates it with the tongs, moves into place, gets the chisel and removes it, rotates it again and as this continues, it gets faster and faster and faster. I need you to go ahead to make a tinkering check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you want any Guidance?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, I'll take anything I can get.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Cat's Grace is what, dexterity?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, technically that's a dex check, so if you have Cat's Grace I'll take it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is it a dex check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's what you gave to Grog earlier.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And so are now my 3rd-level spells. Nothing more.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If you have any inspiration, I'll also take it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, sure. I'll give you some. I will sing to you. I will sing: (singing) bang bang, Percy's ball-peen hammer goes down, upon the ground! Bang bang, Percy's ball-peen hammer makes a really, really big sound. (vocalizing)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The actual heat from the Core Anvil is enough that when you hold the trammel against it, it gives it just enough of a malleable edge for you to go ahead and chisel through it without issue. As you're going, it's three checks: one for each trammel. So the first one?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's without inspiration. That's 31.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 31. (skittering, clanging) After about five minutes or so, you finish and grab one of the trammels and (clang) onto the ground. Begin on the other. (skittering)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Slow down!

lines.name: TALIESIN, MARISHA
lines.text: (groan)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Try again. Inspiration it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I might be able to inspiration this because that was a really bad roll. Both of them are the same. Both of them are two. And this is not one of those things where I can fix. It's either good or it's bad.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We might be able to fix it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to try and add a little bit of inspiration, maybe.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (groans)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's not very good. That's 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17. Okay. The second trammel, as you're chiseling along, you feel as the metal (cracking) begins to bend and snap in one place. It's still one piece. (sighs) The DC has gone up, but you get one more shot at that one.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can I get one more inspiration if you got any? Are you out?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I've used five, and I think I get six.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's take another one. Just in case because Jesus fucking Christ.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The DC was 20. Now it's 25.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If this fails, it's going to break a trammel.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Please. I will happily take that inspiration, please.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. I will inspire you with some bullshit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No one has any other type of Guidance or anything?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm looking. I've got nothing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't have anything; I just hit things!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a skill check. It's not a save. Oh wait. I don't get to add anything from the hammer for this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. The hammer is allowing the process to take place.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do we need to do this right now? Can we take nappies and come back?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think it has to be soft, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You would have a whole other batch of inspirations in the morning.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, but he's got one more shot at this.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think we have to do it now, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The trance is there. It's up to you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Give me one more inspiration if you can, and we'll see where we go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll sing: (singing) Here's a little song I wrote! It's filled with inspiration note for note. Don't fuck up! Or I'll kill you! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't feel good.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: One at a time.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That'll do. 18, 28, 30.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And we have the inspiration for the third one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You managed to complete the scrolling on the trammel. The trammel is still noticeably fragile, but it seems functional. The enchantment will be channeled. So second trammel's done. Final check on the third and final trammel.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come on. Jesus.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This is so stressful.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Rolled a 12 on the inspiration dice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percival, you take it and the heated edge of it is burning into your hand a little bit and you walk over and drop it into the trough water. (sizzling) Turn around, drop it next to the third and final piece.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And as Percival hits-- He passes out onto the stairs, half-leaning onto the stairs. You catch him. Grog, you look at your feet where Percival left the last piece and you reach down and pick up the three trammels. They're about that long, each of them, and they're these heavy spikes that come to a gradual spiraling twist at the tip. They're covered in intricate, beautiful scrolling of some sort of arcane language that you are unfamiliar with, and you don't think you've been so proud to be part of crafting anything like this before.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Kidding!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is a step up from fine leather boots, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, it's true.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And with the completion of the trammels, this leg of your journey now complete, we're going to close tonight's episode. Good game. (sighs) We'll pick up this at GenCon next week at our live show.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So GenCon we're going to start with trying to get out of an active volcano?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, I think we'll assume that we're going to take a mansion rest and we'll come out of a mansion rest. Can we assume that's going to be it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you want to take that point now, we'll say with the end of this episode you guys take a mansion rest? No?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Or are you tapped out? Do you have any spells left, Scanlan?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I saved one level eight spell for such a thing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So we head into the mansion.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I technically have one 7th-level spell, so if we want to go into the mansion and then I can Plane Shift us home, we can do that. Or wherever we want.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So we can Plane Shift, mansion wherever we need.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And if we go into the mansion, the first purple servant that hands me a salad, I behead unless it's the GoFiBePo.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So are you going to long rest and then Plane Shift or Plane Shift and then long rest wherever you land?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Plane Shift and then long rest.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So that's the only thing. It might be good to rest inside the mansion so he can't attack us before we attack him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Are we going straight to him?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We don't know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right. Mansion.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I will be burning my 7th-level spell at the top of the day instead of at the end.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So let's Plane Shift somewhere and mansion.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, no. I can only Plane Shift us on this plane by basically hacking the spell because the mansion is another plane of existence. So I can't Plane Shift us on this plane. I have to plane to another plane.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We need to rest. Let's rest. Yeah, ignore it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We'll figure it out at GenCon. We'll figure it out in Indianapolis.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fuck it, we'll do it live!

lines.name: TALIESIN, TRAVIS
lines.text: We'll do it live!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty, then. So. We'll pick up there next week at GenCon. (exhales) All right, guys.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That fucking giant sword-swinging bastard! Is he even wearing underpants under that? We don't know.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, he's not. I saw his balls. I saw his golden balls.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a big iron pendulum swinging around.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Legendary action: the nut swing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh goodness gracious, we got to get all of our stuff. Do we need to bring our own binder to GenCon?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Otherwise, the rest of you, thank you for joining us, as always. Rest well. See you next week, and is it Thursday yet? Good night.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: [music]
